RecitationInstructions.ab: Y2.1] zaōϑra āiiese yešti imat̰ barəsma blswm QDM mʾhlwk' HNHTWN-tn' haδa.zaōϑrəm OD miϑrəm (Y2.11). Abbreviation mark after zaōϑra āiiese yešti (Y2.1a) likely missing, until imat̰ barəsma (Y2.1j).

Parallels.ab: barəsma haδa.zaōϑrəm ~ Y3.1, Y22.2, VrS78.13 barəsmana paiti.bərəta haδa.zaōϑra.

Nerangs.ab: ēn gyāg barsom ō ī māhrōy nihišn imat̰ barəsma aδa.zaōϑrəm haδa.aiβiiā̊ŋhanəm aṣ̌aiia frastarətəm āiiese yešti
"Between imat̰ barəsma and haδa.zaōϑrəm haδa.aiβiiā̊ŋhanəm aṣ̌aiia frastarətəm āiiese yešti he has to put the barsom on the māhrōy."

Quotations.ab: ka-š ranjagīhā ēn and az pāy gōwišn: bišāmrūd ud srīšāmrūd ud cahrušāmrūd; ud šnūman wizārišnīh; ud wāz gīrišnīh; ud srōš barišnīh az yašt bun [tā] imat̰ barəsma haδa.zaōϑrəm...

"If (standing up) is troublesome for him, he should recite the following texts standing up: the passages to be recited twice, three times, and four times; the recitation of the šnūmans; the taking of the bāj; and the srōš-barišnīh from the beginning of the servide up to imat̰ barəsma haδa zaoϑrəm.

Ka juxt 2 tāg be gīrišn ka pad nihān. Ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay hād ēdōn bawēd ciyōn pad srōš-drōn. Pad abāz guftan ēdōn ciyōn pad abārīg abestāg. "Until he reaches imat̰ barəsma, if the barsom has one twig too few he should insert it; if (it has one) too many he should pull it out. If he has recited beyond imat̰ barəsma, if there are too few he should insert them, if too many he should leave (things as they are). If (two) twigs are joined, they should be counted as two twigs if it is not visible. There is one who says thus 'it is as in the Srōš-drōn service. As far as repeating the text is concerned it is as for the other Avestan texts.' For the Srōš-drōn one should put the drōn and gōšudāg in place; there is no need for the frasast. And one should place three pieces of firewood and incese on the right-hand side."

ModernPractice.ab: "The chief priest glances over all the implements and from here while reciting upto imat̰ barəsma, bending down he goes on touching the bundle to the moon-shaped stand. The chief priest and the assistant priest both recite: zaoϑra āiiese yešti … āiiese yešti imat ̰barəsma. From here the chief priest sits crossed legged and placing the bundle on the moon-shaped stands, on that he puts two fingers of the left hand. haδa.zaoϑrəm haδa.aiβiiā̊ŋhanəm aṣ̌aiia frastarətəm āiiese yešti.

"While reciting Y.2.1, starting with the words "I long for the libation [zōhr] in the Yasna" ( zaothra āyēsē yeshti) and ending with the phrase "I long for this barsom with the libation in the Yasna" ( hadha zaothrem imat baresma āyēsē yēshti), the zot, still standing, touches the barsom to the tips of each crescent-shaped stand (māh-rūy) for every sentence recited. Repeating "this barsom" (imat baresma), the zōt places the barsom across the top of the two stands (barsom-dān). He sits down cross-legged on the stone seat, places the second and third fingers of his left hand on the elevated barsom, and rests his right hand on the upper rim of the large metal basin."
